snippet: Synchronized swimmers — like the Russians who dominated Tuesday’s duet contest, with their thick makeup and gelatin-shellacked hair — sometimes have trouble convincing skeptics of their sport’s difficulty.
abstract: Synchronized swimmers at the London Olympic Games--like the Russians who dominated the duet contest to win the gold medal, with their thick makeup and gelatin-shellacked hair--sometimes have trouble convincing skeptics of their sport’s difficulty; many of the competitors' routines follow particular themes.
lead_paragraph: Synchronized swimmers — like the Russians who dominated Tuesday’s duet contest, with their thick makeup and gelatin-shellacked hair — sometimes have trouble convincing skeptics of their sport’s difficulty.

headline.seo: In Synchronized Swimming at the Olympics, the Idiosyncratic Meets the Intricate
headline.main: Yes, It’s a Sport, and Russia’s Sinister Dolls Win
headline.print_headline: Yes, It’s a Sport, and Russia’s Sinister Dolls Win
